Promotion Terms: BitPay Cardholders may: Promotion Terms: BitPay Cardholders may refer others to become new Cardholders. If a referred person acquires a Card and loads at least US$100 within 30 days of signing up for the Card, then BitPay will provide an incentive US$10 Card load to both the referring Cardholder and new Cardholder. The new Cardholder must not previously have signed up for a virtual or physical BitPay Card. The referred person must sign up using the referring Cardholder’s referral code. BitPay reserves the right to modify this promotion or discontinue eligibility for the promotion at any time and in its sole discretion.

linkedWalletWarnMsg: Keep in mind that once the funds are received in your {{selectedWallet}} wallet, to move them you will need to have enough funds in your {{chain}} linked wallet {{linkedWalletName}} to pay the {{chainCoin}} miner fees.

We’re always listening for ways we can i: We’re always listening for ways we can improve your experience. Feel free to leave us a review in the app store or request a new feature. Also, let us know if you experience any technical issues.
If enabled, wallets will also try to spe: If enabled, wallets will also try to spend unconfirmed funds. However, unconfirmed funds are not allowed for spending with merchants, BitPay Card loads, or BitPay in-app gift card purchases.
If enabled, the transaction nonce could: If enabled, the transaction nonce could be changed on the confirm view. This is an advanced feature, use cautiously.
If enabled, your eth transactions will b: If enabled, your eth transactions will be queued if there is a pending transaction with a lower account nonce. This is an advanced feature, use cautiously.
If enabled, your transactions will be ma: If enabled, your transactions will be marked as non-final, and you will have the possibility, while they are unconfirmed, to replace them with transactions that pay higher fees. Note that some merchants do not accept non-final transactions until they are confirmed.

The higher the fee, the greater the ince: The higher the fee, the greater the incentive a miner has to include that transaction in a block. Current fees are determined based on network load and the selected policy.

WalletConnect is an open source protocol: WalletConnect is an open source protocol for connecting decentralized applications to mobile wallets with QR code scanning or deep linking.
wants to change network to a different o: {{peerName}} wants to change network to a different one than the selected wallet. Please, try connecting to a different DeFi or DApp.

All of your wallet balance may not be av: All of your {{currencyName}} wallet balance may not be available for immediate spending.
The XRP ledger requires that all wallets: The XRP ledger requires that all wallets maintain a minimum balance of 20 XRP. This non-refundable 20 XRP will remain permanently locked in your wallet.
The total amount of stored in this walle: The total amount of {{wallet}} stored in this wallet.
Not including locked funds required for: Not including locked funds required for activation.
The amount of immediately spendable from: The amount of {{currencyName}} immediately spendable from this wallet.
The amount of stored in this wallet with: The amount of {{currencyName}} stored in this wallet with less than 1 blockchain confirmation.
The amount of stored in this wallet that: The amount of {{currencyName}} stored in this wallet that is allocated as inputs to your pending transaction proposals. The amount is determined using unspent transaction outputs associated with this wallet and may be more than the actual amounts associated with your pending transaction proposals.
Failed to update balance, please try aga: Failed to update balance, please try again later.
Try entering any passwords you may have: Try entering any passwords you may have set in the past
Remember there are no special requiremen: Remember there are no special requirements for the password (numbers, symbols, etc.)
Keep in mind your encryption password is: Keep in mind your encryption password is not the 12-word recovery phrase
You can always reset your encryption pas: You can always reset your encryption password on your key settings under the option Clear Encryption Password using your 12-word recovery phrase
BCH wallets use the CashAddr format by: {{appName}} BCH wallets use the CashAddr format by default
If you need to send to \"old\" addresses: If you need to send to "old" addresses (like the one you just pasted), and you are SURE those are BCH addresses, you can "translate" them to the corresponding address in CashAddr format.
The wallet you are using does not match: The wallet you are using does not match the network and/or the currency of the address provided
Be careful. Some inputs of this transac: Be careful. Some inputs of this transaction have no confirmations. Please wait until they are confirmed.
Be careful. Until it confirms, the trans: Be careful. Until it confirms, the transaction could be replaced/redirected by the sender. You can try to speed it up by using a higher fee
This transaction is taking longer than u: This transaction is taking longer than usual to confirm. You can try to speed it up by using a higher fee.
You can try to speed it up by using a hi: You can try to speed it up by using a higher fee
The fee you are using is lower than Supe: The fee you are using is lower than Super Economy level. It’s not recommended as this transaction may not confirm or will take very long to confirm.
Insufficient funds for paying speed up f: Insufficient funds for paying speed up fee.
Could not decrypt file, check your passw: Could not decrypt file, check your password
There are some misunderstood outputs, pl: There are some misunderstood outputs, please view on blockchain.
Something went wrong. Please try again.
There are no records of your wallet on o: There are no records of your wallet on our servers. If you are importing a BIP44 compatible wallet from a 3rd party you can continue to recreate it. If you wallet is not BIP44 compatible, you will not be able to access its funds.
Make sure to enter your password in adva: Make sure to enter your password in advanced options
Invalid derivation path for selected coi: Invalid derivation path for selected coin
Enter your recovery phrase (usually 12-w: Enter your recovery phrase (usually 12-words) in the correct order. Separate each word with a single space only (no commas or any other punctuation). For backup phrases in non-English languages: Some words may include special symbols, so be sure to spell all the words correctly.
This field is only for users who, in pre: This field is only for users who, in previous versions (it's not supported anymore), set a password to protect their recovery phrase. This field is not for your encrypt password.
Your encryption password has been remove: Your encryption password has been removed. This key is now decrypted.
To disable encryption for your wallet, p: To disable encryption for your wallet, please enter your encryption password below.
To get started, you’ll need to enter a v: To get started, you’ll need to enter a valid address or select an existing contact or wallet.
Add coins like Bitcoin and Dogecoin, and: Add coins like Bitcoin and Dogecoin, and also tokens like USDC and APE
Requires multiple people or devices and: Requires multiple people or devices and is the most secure
This currency is already associated with: This currency is already associated with the selected wallet
Could not find any ERC20 contract attach: Could not find any ERC20 contract attached to the provided address. Recheck the contract address and network of the associated wallet.
You will not be able to add funds to you: You will not be able to add funds to your wallet until you backup your recovery phrase.
Would you like to backup your key?: Would you like to backup your key?
If you delete the BitPay app or lose you: If you delete the BitPay app or lose your device, you'll need your recovery phrase regain access to your funds.
Because your encrypted password is not s: Because your encrypted password is not stored by BitPay, there is no way to reset it.
If you need to regain access to your wal: If you need to regain access to your wallet because you have forgotten or lost the encrypt password, you must restore the wallet using the 12 word recovery phrase.
If you do not have the recovery phrase,: If you do not have the recovery phrase, you will not be able to regain access to your wallet
Share this invitation with the devices j: Share this invitation with the devices joining this account. Each copayer has their own recovery phrase. To recover funds stored in a Shared Wallet you will need the recovery phrase from each copayer.
Waiting for authorized copayers to join: Waiting for authorized copayers to join
Your encryption password has been set. T: Your encryption password has been set. This key is now encrypted.
Your wallet will be encrypted. Whenever: Your wallet will be encrypted. Whenever you make a transaction, we will ask for the password. This cannot be recovered, so be sure to store it safely.
Multisig wallets require multisig device: Multisig wallets require multisig devices to set up. It takes longer to complete but it's the recommended security configuration for long term storage.
The single address feature will force th: The single address feature will force the wallet to only use one address rather than generating new addresses.
Add coins like Bitcoin and Dogecoin and: Add coins like Bitcoin and Dogecoin and also tokens like USDC and PAX
Use an existing recovery phrase to impor: Use an existing recovery phrase to import an existing wallet
Permanently deletes all wallets using th:
Permanently deletes all wallets using this key. 
THIS ACTION CANNOT BE REVERSED.
Are you sure you want to delete all wall: Are you sure you want to delete all wallets using this key?
Your wallet is all that is needed to acc: Your wallet is all that is needed to access your funds. Be sure to protect your wallet and store it only on secure devices. BitPay does not have access to your recovery phrase, so you alone are responsible for your wallets. If you share wallet access with external services, you take responsibility for the risk of theft or breach.
You can import this wallet into other de: You can import this wallet into other devices through the BitPay scanner.
Your extended private keys are all that: Your extended private keys are all that is needed to access your funds. Be sure to protect your private keys and store them only on secure devices. BitPay does not have access to your private keys, so you alone are responsible for your keys. If you share key access with external services, you take responsibility for the risk of theft or breach. Only advanced users should handle extended private keys directly.
There are no wallets with funds availabl: There are no wallets with funds available to use this feature.
A wallet is like a vault stored on your: A wallet is like a vault stored on your device containing your crypto funds. Much like a vault, your wallet will only be accessible with the recovery phrase.
Your wallet recovery phrase is composed: Your wallet recovery phrase is composed of 12 randomly selected words. If you ever lose or damage your device, you can re-gain access to your wallet as long as you have your 12-word recovery phrase.
In order to protect your funds from bein: In order to protect your funds from being accessible to hackers and thieves, the recovery phrase must be kept somewhere safe and remain a secret.
Prevent an unauthorized user from sendin: Prevent an unauthorized user from sending funds out of your wallet.
View all the ways to manage and configur: View all the ways to manage and configure your key.
To continue please enter your encryption: To continue please enter your encryption password.
This password cannot be recovered. If th: This password cannot be recovered. If this password is lost, funds can only be recovered by reimporting your 12-word recovery phrase.
Use more than one device to create a mul: Use more than one device to create a multisig wallet
Joining another user's multisig wallet r: Joining another user's multisig wallet requires an invitation to join
Your recovery key is composed of 12 rand: Your recovery key is composed of 12 randomly selected words. Take a couple of minutes to carefully write down each word in the order they appear.
Share this QR code to receive in your wa: Share this QR code to receive {{amountUnitStr}} in your wallet {{walletName}}.
A Destination Tag is an optional number: A Destination Tag is an optional number that corresponds to an invoice or a XRP account on an exchange.
